page.title: 09BIDDISHAM LANDSCAPE
page.content: OUR JOURNEY OFF THE A38 THROUGH BIDDISHAM VILLAGE WAS ALONG A ROAD NEW TO THOSE OF US TAKING PART. FOR THE FIRST KM WE PASSED LARGE COTTAGES SET IN THEIR OWN GROUNDS AMID FLOWERS,FRUIT TREES AND VEGETABLES.WE LEFT THE HOUSES TO FIND THE ROAD FOLLOWING THE COURSE OF THE OLD RIVER AXE.THE RIVER WAS FULL AS IT TWISTED AND TURNED TO JOIN THE MAIN RIVER. THE FIELDS ALONGSIDE THE RIVER WERE RICH WITH GRASS.SOME FIELD HAD BEEN CROPPEDAND BALES OF HAY WERE AWAITING COLLECTION. COWS BROWSED ALONGSIDE THE RIVER OR LAY CONTENDEDLY CHEWING. WITH THE SUN SHINING,THE LANDSCAPE INVITED US TO LINGER RATHER THAN CONTINUE OUR EXPLORATION.
